property.name: Traits
property.value: Silvan. Noble.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After a Silvan ally enters play, that ally gets +1 Ò, +1 Û, and +1 Ú until the end of the round.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Silvan. Scout.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After Naith Guide enters play, choose a hero. That hero does not exhaust to quest this round.

property.name: Text
property.value: Action: Ready a hero you control. Then, if your threat is 20 or less and this is the first time you played a copy of Swift and Silent this round, return this card to your hand instead of discarding it.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Attach to a Ï or Rohan hero. Restricted.
Attached hero gets +1 Û (+2 Û instead if attached hero is Éomer).
Response: After attached hero attacks alone, exhaust Firefoot to choose a non-unique enemy engaged with you. Excess damage dealt by this attack is assigned to the chosen enemy

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Doomed X.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: Cancel X damage just dealt to a hero.

property.name: Text
property.value: Action: Choose another player. That player gains control of Blue Mountain Trader. Then, that player moves 1 resource from the resource pool of a hero he controls to the resource pool of a hero you control, or Blue Mountain Trader is discarded.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Limit 1 per deck. Attach to a hero.
Response: When attached hero is destroyed, add The Fall of Gil-galad to the victory display to reduce your threat by X, where X is the attached hero’s threat cost.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Gondor. Ranger.

property.name: Keywords
property.value: Secrecy 2.

property.name: Text
property.value: Response: After Ithilien Lookout enters play, look at the top card of the encounter deck. If it is an enemy, you may discard it.

property.name: Text
property.value: Action: Return a Silvan ally you control to your hand to search the top 5 cards of your deck for a Silvan ally. Put that ally into play and shuffle the other cards back into your deck. You can only play 1 copy of The Tree People each phase.

property.name: Text
property.value:
X is the number of players in the game.
Action: Starting with the first player, each player chooses 1 different option: ready a hero he controls, add 1 resource to the resource pool of a hero he controls, draw 1 card, or shuffle 1 card from his discard pile into his deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Text
property.value: Setup: Set Chief Turch and Munuv Dûv Ravine aside, out of play. Make Old South Road the active location. Each player searches the encounter deck for a Boar Clan enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Text
property.value: Time 2. Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, each player discards his hand and draws 2 cards. Place 2 time counters on this stage.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Make Munuv Dûv Ravine the active location (returning any previous active location to the staging area). Each player discards each Item and each Mount attachment he controls. Each player chooses 1 ally he controls and discards each other ally he controls.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Text
property.value:
When Revealed: Each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Boar Clan enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck. Each player shuffles his discard pile into his draw deck and draws 1 card.
Forced: At the end of the combat phase, advance to stage 3A.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Put Chief Turch into play, engaged with the first player.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Text
property.value:
Time X. X is 5 times the number of players in the game.
If a hero is destroyed at this stage, the players lose the game.
Forced: After the last time counter is removed from this stage, the players make engagement checks. Then, each engaged enemy makes an attack. If no heroes are destroyed by these attacks, the players win the game.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Dunland. Boar Clan.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Cannot have attachments.
Cannot leave play.
Chief Turch engages the first player.
Forced: After an enemy engages a player, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Traits
property.value: Enedwaith. Hills. River.

property.name: Text
property.value: Dunland enemies get +1 Û and +1 Ú.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: At the end of the refresh phase, remove 1 time counter from the current quest.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Dunland. Boar Clan.

property.name: Text
property.value:
Boar Clan Stalker gets +1 Û and +1 Ú for each resource token on it (limit +4).
Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, put a resource token on Boar Clan Stalker.

property.name: Traits
property.value: Dunland. Boar Clan.

property.name: Text
property.value: Forced: After the engaged player draws any number of cards, deal Boar Clan Warrior a shadow card.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û for each shadow card on it.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Traits
property.value: Enedwaith. Hills.

property.name: Text
property.value:
X is the number of resource tokens on this card.
Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, place 1 resource token here.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Traits
property.value: Enedwaith. Hills.

property.name: Text
property.value:
While Hills of Dunland is in the staging area, it gains: 'Forced: After a player draws any number of cards, discard the top card of the encounter deck. If the discarded card is a Dunland enemy, put it into play engaged with that player. This ability does not stack with other copies of Hills of Dunland.
Travel: Each player draws a card to travel here.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Traits
property.value: Enedwaith. Plains.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Plains of Enedwaith is the active location, players do not draw a card during the resource phase.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û (+3 Û instead if undefended).

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Traits
property.value: Enedwaith. River.

property.name: Text
property.value: While Hithaeglir Stream is the active location, players draw 2 cards during the resource phase instead of 1.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Attacking enemy gets +1 Û. Deal it an additional shadow card.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Each player draws a card. Each player discards each ally from his hand. If no allies are discarded this way, Frenzied Attack gains surge.

property.name: Shadow
property.value: Shadow: Until the end of the round, attacking enemy cannot take damage.

property.name: Encounter Set
property.value: The Dunland Trap

property.name: Text
property.value: When Revealed: Attach to the active location. (Counts as a Condition attachment with the text: 'Limit 1 per location. Forced: After attached location is explored, each player searches the encounter deck and discard pile for a Dunland enemy and puts it into play engaged with him. Shuffle the encounter deck.')
